choices.text:
explain use of Large Language Models (LLM) in AI research
Large Language Models are very large neural networks that have been trained on massive amounts of data to capture a wide range of linguistic and semantic information. These models can be used for various tasks such as language modeling, machine translation, question answering, and more recently, pre-training for other AI systems.

### Reference(s):
1. https://arxiv.org/abs/2020.05368
